yesno_radio_buttons(object, method, options={})

Dispalys two radio buttons; one for yes and one for no. Accepts the following options: 

  <tt>:gap</tt> -- specify the text to put between the yes/no options. For example '<br/>' would put the yes/no options on different lines. (Default is 3 spaces)
  <tt>:no_first</tt> -- Puts the 'no' radio button first. (Default is 'yes' first)

[Source]

     # File lib/gloc-rails.rb, line 153
153:     def yesno_radio_buttons(object, method, options={})
154:       options= {:no_first => false, :gap => '&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;'}.merge(options)
155:       y= "#{radio_button object, method, '1'} #{l_YesNo true}"
156:       n= "#{radio_button object, method, '0'} #{l_YesNo false}"
157:       options[:no_first] ? n+options[:gap]+y : y+options[:gap]+n
158:     end
